Class GameState

java.lang.Object
State
GameState
public class GameState
extends State
This class is the game state of the game.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private Entity C1
    The first entity of the character.
    private Entity C2
    The second entity of the character.
    private Entity C3
    The third entity of the character.
    private int column
    The column value of the first of the matching tiles.
    private Entity E1
    The first entity of the computer.
    private Entity E2
    The second entity of the computer.
    private Entity E3
    The third entity of the computer.
    private boolean isMatch
    If matching tiles are found, its value will be true.
    private boolean isSwitch
    If there is a swap operation, its value will be true.
    private int ownerLastMove
    It is the owner of the last matching tiles. 0 = player, 1 = computer
    private boolean paused
    This variable is initially false.
    private boolean playerTurn
    This variable is true, if it is the player's turn to play.
    private int row
    The row value of the first of the matching tiles.
    private java.lang.String statusMessage
    The status message of the game.
    private int switched_i1
    The row value of the first of the switched tiles.
    private int switched_i2
    The row value of the second of the switched tiles.
    private int switched_j1
    The column value of the first of the switched tiles.
    private int switched_j2
    The column value of the second of the switched tiles.
    private Tile[][] tiles
    The Tile array contains tiles of the game.
    private int type
    Match type 0 : horizontal match 1 : vertical match

  • Field Details

    • tiles

      private Tile[][] tiles
      The Tile array contains tiles of the game. colors of the tiles: blue, red, green.

    • isMatch

      private boolean isMatch
      If matching tiles are found, its value will be true. Otherwise, false.

    • row

      private int row
      The row value of the first of the matching tiles.

    • column

      private int column
      The column value of the first of the matching tiles.

    • type

      private int type
      Match type 0 : horizontal match 1 : vertical match

    • isSwitch

      private boolean isSwitch
      If there is a swap operation, its value will be true. Otherwise, false.

    • switched_i1

      private int switched_i1
      The row value of the first of the switched tiles.

    • switched_j1

      private int switched_j1
      The column value of the first of the switched tiles.

    • switched_i2

      private int switched_i2
      The row value of the second of the switched tiles.

    • switched_j2

      private int switched_j2
      The column value of the second of the switched tiles.

    • paused

      private boolean paused
      This variable is initially false. It becomes true if the player presses the pause button.

    • C1

      private Entity C1
      The first entity of the character.

      The second entity of the character.

      The second entity of the computer.

      private Entity E3
      The third entity of the computer.

    • playerTurn

      private boolean playerTurn
      This variable is true, if it is the player's turn to play.

    • ownerLastMove

      private int ownerLastMove
      It is the owner of the last matching tiles. 0 = player, 1 = computer

    • statusMessage

      private java.lang.String statusMessage
      The status message of the game.

    • updatePreviousMove

      private void updatePreviousMove​(int i1, int j1, int i2, int j2)
      This method stores the information of the switched tiles.
      Parameters:
      i1 - the row value of the first tile
      j1 - the column value of the first tile
      i2 - the row value of the second tile
      j2 - the column value of the second tile

    • switchTile

      private void switchTile​(int i1, int j1, int i2, int j2)
      This method switches the selected tiles.
      Parameters:
      i1 - the row value of the first tile
      j1 - the column value of the first tile
      i2 - the row value of the second tile
      j2 - the column value of the second tile

    • checkMatchingTiles

      private boolean checkMatchingTiles()
      This method checks for matching tiles in the game.
      Returns:
      true if the matching tiles are found. Otherwise, false.

    • matchFound

      private void matchFound​(int newType, int i, int j)
      In this method, the matching tiles are disappeared.
      Parameters:
      newType - type of the match
      i - The row value of the first of the matching tiles.
      j - The column value of the first of the matching tiles.

    • oneTileDamage

      private java.lang.String oneTileDamage​(Tile tile, int j)
      This method calculates the damage for the taken tile
      Parameters:
      tile - the tile that will damage
      j - the column value of the tile
      Returns:
      the damage value and the attacked entity. It is used to statusMessage.

    • XYZrule

      private double XYZrule​(java.awt.Color tile, java.awt.Color enemy)
      This method determines the damage for the xyz rule.
      Parameters:
      tile - the color of the tile that will damage
      enemy - the color of the entity that will take damage
      Returns:
      the value of the damage

    • fillEmptyTiles

      private void fillEmptyTiles()
      This method fills in the location the disappearing tiles.
